intro: Haplopappus alternifolius, commonly known as the alternateleaf pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often covered in fine hairs, while its small yellow flowers appear in clusters. The plant's structure and growth habits make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
